pedagogical_approaches.name: Project-Based Learning
pedagogical_approaches.description: Students learn by actively engaging in real-world, meaningful projects over extended periods, solving authentic problems and creating public products.

phases.name: Launch/Driving Question
phases.description: Present authentic problem or driving question that hooks students

phases.name: Investigation & Research
phases.description: Students gather information, explore resources, build knowledge

phases.name: Create & Develop
phases.description: Students work on project artifacts, prototypes, or products

phases.name: Critique & Revise
phases.description: Peer feedback and iteration on work

phases.name: Present & Reflect
phases.description: Share with authentic audience, reflect on learning

key_elements: Driving question connected to real-world problem
Student voice and choice in process

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Provide structured project templates, break into smaller milestones, assign specific roles
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Offer choice within constraints, provide resource lists, checkpoint conferences
differentiation_strategies.at_level: Full choice in approach, self-directed with teacher guidance
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Extended scope, mentor role for peers, connect to community experts

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual project planners, partner with bilingual peer, allow multimedia products
el_adaptations.expanding: Sentence frames for presentations, vocabulary word wall, graphic organizers
el_adaptations.bridging: Academic language expectations, peer editing for language

assessment_strategies: Project rubric with content and process criteria

pedagogical_approaches.name: Place-Based Learning
pedagogical_approaches.description: Learning connected to local environment, culture, and community. Uses local heritage, landscapes, and experiences as foundations for studying core subjects.

phases.name: Connect to Place
phases.description: Introduce local context, environment, or community connection

phases.name: Explore the Place
phases.description: Direct experience with local environment (virtual or physical)

phases.name: Study the Place
phases.description: Investigate local phenomena, history, or issues

phases.name: Act for the Place
phases.description: Apply learning to benefit local community

phases.name: Reflect
phases.description: Connect personal meaning and broader concepts

key_elements: Local environment as primary learning resource

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Guided observation sheets, partner exploration, concrete local examples
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Structured inquiry questions, local mentor pairing
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Design community action project, present to local officials

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual documentation, familiar neighborhood contexts, home language connections
el_adaptations.expanding: Local vocabulary development, community interviews with support
el_adaptations.bridging: Academic writing about local issues, presentation to community

pedagogical_approaches.name: Passion-Based Learning
pedagogical_approaches.description: Students explore topics they are genuinely passionate about. Teacher acts as facilitator helping students connect personal interests to learning objectives.

phases.name: Passion Discovery
phases.description: Students identify or share their interests and passions

phases.name: Connection Building
phases.description: Link passion to learning objectives and standards

phases.name: Deep Dive
phases.description: Student-directed exploration of passion topic

phases.name: Create & Share
phases.description: Produce artifact demonstrating learning through passion lens

phases.name: Reflect & Connect
phases.description: Reflect on learning and broader applications

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Provide passion topic options, structured exploration guides, mentor pairing
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Choice within framework, checkpoint supports
differentiation_strategies.at_level: Full autonomy with teacher conference support
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Expert mentorship, community presentation opportunities

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual passion inventory, home culture connections, multimedia products
el_adaptations.expanding: Bilingual research options, vocabulary support for passion area

pedagogical_approaches.name: 5E Lesson Model
pedagogical_approaches.description: Research-based instructional model with five phases: Engage, Explore, Explain, Elaborate, and Evaluate. Student-centered with teacher as facilitator.

phases.name: Engage
phases.description: Capture interest, assess prior knowledge, surface misconceptions

phases.name: Explore
phases.description: Hands-on investigation, guided discovery, data collection

phases.name: Explain
phases.description: Make sense of exploration, develop vocabulary, teacher guides understanding

phases.name: Elaborate
phases.description: Apply understanding to new contexts, extend learning

phases.name: Evaluate
phases.description: Assess understanding, student self-reflection

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Structured exploration protocols, vocabulary pre-teaching, guided discovery sheets
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Partial exploration guides, tiered explain questions
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Design own exploration, elaborate to advanced applications

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual exploration guides, partner work, labeled diagrams
el_adaptations.expanding: Sentence frames for explain phase, vocabulary cards
el_adaptations.bridging: Academic explanation expectations, peer teaching opportunities

pedagogical_approaches.name: 3 Act Math Tasks
pedagogical_approaches.description: Problem-solving structure using storytelling: Act 1 introduces conflict visually, Act 2 gathers information, Act 3 reveals resolution. Low floor, high ceiling.

phases.name: Act 1: The Hook
phases.description: Present compelling visual/video with minimal words, students notice and wonder

phases.name: Estimation
phases.description: Students make estimates (too high, too low, just right)

phases.name: Act 2: Information Gathering
phases.description: Students request information needed, teacher reveals data

phases.name: Problem Solving
phases.description: Students work to solve using gathered information

phases.name: Act 3: The Reveal
phases.description: Show actual answer, compare to estimates and solutions

phases.name: Sequel (Optional)
phases.description: Extend with related question or variation

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Estimation support, information organizer, calculation scaffolds
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Guiding questions, strategy hints available
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Create sequel problems, multiple solution methods

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual-heavy acts, partner discussion, labeled diagrams
el_adaptations.expanding: Notice/wonder sentence frames, math vocabulary support

pedagogical_approaches.name: Design-Based Thinking Lessons
pedagogical_approaches.description: Five-step creative problem-solving: Empathize, Define, Ideate, Prototype, and Test. Develops innovation skills through iterative design.

phases.name: Empathize
phases.description: Understand user needs through observation, interviews, research

phases.name: Define
phases.description: Clearly articulate the problem based on empathy research

phases.name: Ideate
phases.description: Brainstorm multiple solutions without judgment

phases.name: Prototype
phases.description: Create quick, testable models of best ideas

phases.name: Test
phases.description: Get feedback, iterate, refine solutions

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Empathy map templates, structured ideation prompts, prototype kits
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Guiding questions for each phase, checkpoint feedback
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Complex user scenarios, multiple iterations, peer mentoring

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual empathy maps, sketch-based ideation, hands-on prototyping
el_adaptations.expanding: Sentence frames for user interviews, design vocabulary

pedagogical_approaches.name: Peer Teaching
pedagogical_approaches.description: Students teach and learn from each other using strategies like Jigsaw, Think-Pair-Share, and peer explanation. Teaching deepens understanding.

phases.name: Expert Development
phases.description: Students master their portion of content individually or in expert groups

phases.name: Preparation to Teach
phases.description: Students plan how to explain concept to peers

phases.name: Peer Teaching
phases.description: Students teach their content to peers in mixed groups

phases.name: Clarification
phases.description: Address questions, teacher clarifies misconceptions

phases.name: Integration
phases.description: Apply combined knowledge from all peer teachers

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Simpler content section, teaching template, partner support
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Teaching prompts, visual aids provided
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Complex content, support struggling peers, synthesize connections

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual teaching aids, bilingual partner, simplified content
el_adaptations.expanding: Sentence frames for teaching, vocabulary cards to share

pedagogical_approaches.name: Cross-Age Peer Teaching
pedagogical_approaches.description: Older students (2-3 years older) tutor younger students. Benefits both through social constructivist learning and mentorship.

phases.name: Tutor Preparation
phases.description: Older students learn content and teaching strategies

phases.name: Relationship Building
phases.description: Tutors and tutees establish rapport

phases.name: Tutoring Session
phases.description: Structured teaching with older student leading

phases.name: Progress Check
phases.description: Assess tutee understanding, tutor adjusts

phases.name: Reflection
phases.description: Both students reflect on learning and teaching

key_elements: Tutor training on content and strategies

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Most struggling tutees paired with patient tutors, extra structure
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Matched ability pairings, clear session guides
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Tutors for complex content, leadership development

el_adaptations.emerging: Bilingual tutors when possible, visual materials, patient pacing
el_adaptations.expanding: Language-supported tutoring materials, vocabulary focus

pedagogical_approaches.name: Inquiry-Based Learning
pedagogical_approaches.description: Active learning starting with questions, problems, or scenarios. Students direct their learning through investigation. Four types: confirmation, structured, guided, open.

phases.name: Question/Problem Posing
phases.description: Present or generate driving question for investigation

phases.name: Hypothesis/Prediction
phases.description: Students make predictions based on prior knowledge

phases.name: Investigation Design
phases.description: Plan approach to answering question (teacher-guided or student-led)

phases.name: Investigation
phases.description: Conduct research, experiments, or exploration

phases.name: Analysis & Conclusion
phases.description: Analyze findings, draw conclusions, connect to question

phases.name: New Questions
phases.description: Generate new questions from investigation

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Confirmation inquiry (known answer), structured protocols, guided questions
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Structured inquiry with some choice in method
differentiation_strategies.at_level: Guided inquiry with student method selection
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Open inquiry with student-generated questions and methods

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual investigation guides, partner investigations, labeled diagrams
el_adaptations.expanding: Sentence frames for hypotheses and conclusions, vocabulary support

pedagogical_approaches.name: Flipped Learning
pedagogical_approaches.description: Direct instruction moves to individual space (videos, readings) before class. Class time used for active learning, problem-solving, and deeper discussion.

phases.name: Pre-Class Content
phases.description: Students engage with video/reading before class (homework)

phases.name: Quick Check
phases.description: Verify pre-class learning, address immediate questions

phases.name: Clarification
phases.description: Address misconceptions from pre-class content

phases.name: Active Application
phases.description: Apply learning through problems, projects, discussions

phases.name: Extension & Synthesis
phases.description: Deepen understanding, connect concepts

phases.name: Prep for Next
phases.description: Preview next pre-class content, assign

key_elements: Active rather than passive class time

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Simplified pre-class content, guided notes, extra in-class support
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Standard content with pause points, tiered application activities
differentiation_strategies.at_level: Full flipped model with independent application
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Extended pre-class content, leadership in class activities

el_adaptations.emerging: Captioned videos, visual-heavy content, partner application
el_adaptations.expanding: Vocabulary pre-teaching in videos, sentence frames for discussion
el_adaptations.bridging: Academic discussion expectations, note-taking from videos

pedagogical_approaches.name: Genius Hour
pedagogical_approaches.description: Dedicated time (typically 20%) for student-chosen passion projects. Based on Google's 20% time. Students pursue self-directed learning with teacher facilitation.

phases.name: Topic Selection
phases.description: Students identify passion topic and driving question

phases.name: Proposal & Planning
phases.description: Create project proposal with goals and timeline

phases.name: Research & Creation
phases.description: Self-directed work on passion project

phases.name: Check-ins & Reflection
phases.description: Regular conferences with teacher, progress updates

phases.name: Presentation
phases.description: Share project with class or community

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Topic suggestions, structured timelines, frequent check-ins, mentor pairing
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Proposal templates, checkpoint conferences
differentiation_strategies.at_level: Full autonomy with teacher support as needed
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Community mentor connections, extended scope projects

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual project planners, home language research allowed, multimedia products
el_adaptations.expanding: Bilingual research options, presentation sentence frames

pedagogical_approaches.name: Makerspace
pedagogical_approaches.description: Collaborative spaces for hands-on creating, tinkering, and inventing. Based on constructionism - learning through building tangible artifacts.

phases.name: Challenge Introduction
phases.description: Present design challenge or open exploration prompt

phases.name: Material Exploration
phases.description: Explore available materials and tools

phases.name: Design & Plan
phases.description: Sketch ideas, plan approach

phases.name: Build & Iterate
phases.description: Create, test, revise, improve

phases.name: Share & Reflect
phases.description: Demonstrate creations, discuss process and learning

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Simplified challenges, material kits, step-by-step guides available
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Choice of challenge difficulty, mentor pairing
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Complex constraints, peer mentoring, advanced tools

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual instructions, hands-on focus over verbal, partner building
el_adaptations.expanding: Vocabulary for materials and processes, labeled workspace

pedagogical_approaches.name: Gamification-Based Learning
pedagogical_approaches.description: Application of game elements (points, badges, leaderboards, challenges) to learning activities. Harnesses engagement principles from games without creating full games.

phases.name: Challenge Setup
phases.description: Introduce learning challenge with game mechanics (points, badges, levels)

phases.name: Gameplay/Learning
phases.description: Students engage with content through gamified activities

phases.name: Progress Tracking
phases.description: Check scores, levels, achievements; provide feedback

phases.name: Reflection
phases.description: Connect game progress to learning goals

phases.name: Level Up Preview
phases.description: Preview next challenge or level

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Lower entry level, scaffolded challenges, more frequent rewards
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Standard progression with hints available
differentiation_strategies.at_level: Full game mechanics with appropriate challenge
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Bonus levels, leaderboard challenges, game design opportunities

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual game interfaces, picture-based challenges, partner play
el_adaptations.expanding: Clear vocabulary in game, sentence frames for responses
el_adaptations.bridging: Full participation in all game elements

pedagogical_approaches.name: Action Civics
pedagogical_approaches.description: Students learn civics by doing civics. Identify personally relevant community issues, research, plan, and take collective action for change.

phases.name: Issue Identification
phases.description: Students identify personally relevant community issues

phases.name: Research & Analysis
phases.description: Investigate issue, gather data, understand stakeholders

phases.name: Action Planning
phases.description: Develop strategy for civic action

phases.name: Take Action
phases.description: Implement civic action (advocacy, service, engagement)

phases.name: Reflect & Report
phases.description: Evaluate impact, reflect on civic participation

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Issue options provided, structured research guides, supported action
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Guided issue selection, research templates
differentiation_strategies.at_level: Independent issue identification and action planning
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Lead action initiatives, engage with officials, mentor peers

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual issue mapping, home community connections, partner participation
el_adaptations.expanding: Civic vocabulary development, sentence frames for advocacy
el_adaptations.bridging: Academic writing for civic purposes, public speaking

pedagogical_approaches.name: Role Play Scenarios/Lessons
pedagogical_approaches.description: Students assume different characters and act out scenarios without scripts. Develops empathy, critical thinking, and communication through immersive experience.

phases.name: Context Setting
phases.description: Introduce scenario, characters, and situation

phases.name: Role Assignment
phases.description: Assign or choose roles, provide character information

phases.name: Preparation
phases.description: Students prepare character perspective and responses

phases.name: Role Play
phases.description: Enact scenario, respond in character

phases.name: Debrief
phases.description: Reflect on experience, connect to learning objectives

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Simpler roles, character cards with prompts, partner support
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Role choice with preparation guides
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Complex roles, scenario design, facilitate debriefs

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual character cards, simple role language, partner roles
el_adaptations.expanding: Sentence frames for in-character responses, vocabulary support

pedagogical_approaches.name: Socratic Seminar
pedagogical_approaches.description: Formal discussion based on text with open-ended questions. Students lead discussion through questioning and critical dialogue. Teacher facilitates rather than directs.

phases.name: Text Preparation
phases.description: Students read and annotate anchor text before seminar

phases.name: Opening
phases.description: Establish norms, pose opening question

phases.name: Inner Circle Discussion
phases.description: Core group discusses with open-ended questions

phases.name: Outer Circle Observation
phases.description: Observers track discussion, prepare questions

phases.name: Circle Switch (if time)
phases.description: Switch roles, new discussion round

phases.name: Closing & Reflection
phases.description: Synthesize insights, reflect on discussion process

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Annotated text support, discussion stems, outer circle first
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Question starters provided, partner pre-discussion
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Generate opening questions, facilitate sections

el_adaptations.emerging: Pre-taught vocabulary, discussion sentence frames, partner preparation
el_adaptations.expanding: Academic discussion stems, vocabulary reference cards
el_adaptations.bridging: Full participation expectations, note-taking role option

pedagogical_approaches.name: 4C Lessons
pedagogical_approaches.description: Framework for 21st century skills: Critical Thinking, Creativity, Collaboration, and Communication. Explicitly teaches and integrates these four skills across content.

phases.name: C-Focus Introduction
phases.description: Introduce which C(s) are emphasized, connect to content

phases.name: Critical Thinking
phases.description: Analyze, evaluate, or synthesize information

phases.name: Creativity
phases.description: Generate novel ideas or solutions

phases.name: Collaboration
phases.description: Work together toward shared goal

phases.name: Communication
phases.description: Share ideas clearly and effectively

phases.name: Reflection
phases.description: Self-assess use of 4Cs

key_elements: Self and peer assessment of skills

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Focus on 1-2 Cs per lesson, structured collaboration, communication scaffolds
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Skill rubrics provided, guided practice of Cs
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Leadership in collaboration, complex critical thinking tasks

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual 4C icons, partner collaboration, multimodal communication
el_adaptations.expanding: Sentence frames for each C, vocabulary for metacognition

pedagogical_approaches.name: Readers Theatre
pedagogical_approaches.description: Interpretive performance of dramatic text without costumes, props, or memorization. Students read aloud from scripts focusing on expression and fluency.

phases.name: Script Introduction
phases.description: Introduce script, assign or choose roles

phases.name: First Read
phases.description: Cold read for comprehension and role familiarity

phases.name: Expression Coaching
phases.description: Teacher models, students practice expressive reading

phases.name: Rehearsal
phases.description: Repeated practice readings with feedback

phases.name: Performance
phases.description: Final read-through for audience

phases.name: Reflection
phases.description: Discuss fluency growth and comprehension

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Simpler roles, fewer lines, highlighted text, partner reading
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Moderate roles, fluency coaching, cue cards
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Narrator or complex roles, peer coaching, script adaptation

el_adaptations.emerging: Shorter roles, picture cues, choral parts, modeling
el_adaptations.expanding: Expression sentence frames, vocabulary pre-teaching
el_adaptations.bridging: Full role participation, expression coaching for others

pedagogical_approaches.name: Culturally and Historically Responsive Literacy
pedagogical_approaches.description: Four-part equity framework by Dr. Gholdy Muhammad: Identity, Skills, Intellect, and Criticality. Centers student identities and develops critical consciousness.

phases.name: Identity
phases.description: Connect content to student identities and experiences

phases.name: Skills
phases.description: Develop academic skills through culturally relevant content

phases.name: Intellect
phases.description: Build knowledge and critical thinking

phases.name: Criticality
phases.description: Analyze power, equity, and anti-oppression in texts/contexts

phases.name: Action & Reflection
phases.description: Connect learning to action for change

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Accessible texts reflecting identities, scaffolded critical questions
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Tiered texts, guided criticality discussions
differentiation_strategies.at_level: Full framework engagement with grade-level texts
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Text selection leadership, action project design

el_adaptations.emerging: Home language connections, visual identity activities, partner criticality
el_adaptations.expanding: Bilingual texts when possible, academic vocabulary for framework
el_adaptations.bridging: Full academic participation across all four pursuits

pedagogical_approaches.name: Unboxing Video
pedagogical_approaches.description: Students create videos revealing items representing concepts, stories, or learning. Leverages familiar YouTube format for engaging demonstrations of understanding.

phases.name: Concept Connection
phases.description: Identify concepts/content to represent through unboxing

phases.name: Item Selection
phases.description: Choose items that represent key concepts/elements

phases.name: Script Planning
phases.description: Plan reveal order and explanations

phases.name: Recording
phases.description: Create unboxing video with explanations

phases.name: Sharing & Feedback
phases.description: Share videos, provide peer feedback

differentiation_strategies.below_level: Item suggestions provided, script templates, partner production
differentiation_strategies.approaching_level: Item choice with connection guidance
differentiation_strategies.above_level: Complex concept representation, professional production quality

el_adaptations.emerging: Visual-heavy production, partner scripting, simple explanations
el_adaptations.expanding: Script sentence frames, vocabulary practice through explanation

category_descriptions.student-centered: Approaches that prioritize student choice, voice, and direction in learning
category_descriptions.inquiry-based: Approaches built around student questioning and investigation
category_descriptions.problem-based: Approaches organized around authentic problems to solve
category_descriptions.collaborative: Approaches emphasizing peer interaction and group learning
category_descriptions.experiential: Approaches centered on real-world experience and action
category_descriptions.hands-on: Approaches focused on physical creation and manipulation
category_descriptions.blended: Approaches combining in-person and digital/independent learning
category_descriptions.discussion-based: Approaches centered on structured academic discourse
category_descriptions.equity-focused: Approaches centering identity, culture, and critical consciousness
category_descriptions.multimedia: Approaches leveraging digital creation and production
category_descriptions.engagement: Approaches designed to maximize student motivation
